intro: Ischaemum tenellum, commonly known as slender goatgrass, is a flowering plant species belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in disturbed soils and grasslands, often found in temperate regions. The plant has slender, erect stems with narrow, linear leaves that are often hairy. Its inflorescence consists of a panicle of spikelets, each bearing two to three small, two-lobed flowers. Ischaemum tenellum is adapted to a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common weed in agricultural fields and natural habitats.
